channel.title: How To Make Folders Under The Start Menu
channel.description:
Ok first of this is what the end result will be.
[img]http://i106.photobucket.com/albums/m256/rs2armor/start_men.jpg[/img]
ok to do this go to [img]http://img297.imageshack.us/img297/9995/mycomptg0.png[/img] then click on [img]http://img329.imageshack.us/img329/2481/cdrivexb9.png[/img] then click [img]http://img328.imageshack.us/img328/8705/docsnsettingyo5.png[/img] now click the username that you are currently logged in on the computer
after that click [img]http://i106.photobucket.com/albums/m256/rs2armor/startmenu.jpg[/img] then [img]http://img208.imageshack.us/img208/4111/programsmr9.png[/img] now [b]Right Click[/b] and click [b]New Folder[/b]
([img]http://i106.photobucket.com/albums/m256/rs2armor/folder.jpg[/img])
now name it as you want it to appear in the start menu in this example i will name it my website name (rs2armor), now put anything you want into it now go to the start menu and see your new folder with its contents.
all done, i just made cuz i was bored...
[center][glow=red,2,300]MADE BY MVP566//DYLAN//RS2ARMOR.COM//RS2ARMOR.ORG//RS2WORLDSWITCHER.NET[/glow][/center]

item.title: How To Make Folders Under The Start Menu
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

mvp566:

well that doesent always work so go away somewhere

Then your doing it wrong.

Also, you can just right click start menu then go to Open All Users then go to Programs.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Make Folders Under The Start Menu

start_men.jpg532×602

ok to do this go to then click on then click now click the username that you are currently logged in on the computer

after that click then now Right Click and click New Folder

()

now name it as you want it to appear in the start menu in this example i will name it my website name (rs2armor), now put anything you want into it now go to the start menu and see your new folder with its contents.

all done, i just made cuz i was bored…
